availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Trumbo (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Elizabeth Allen Trumbo in Woodford County, Kentucky, on October 30, 1839. Father of Frances A. Trumbo, Susan S. Trumbo, Mary H. Trumbo, and John Trumbo. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 116A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 293.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 211.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 82A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000252320, p. 22.
